It will serve as the base for the subsequent parts. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.075, 0.0]. This will define the position and orientation of the 2D sketch plane. 2. **Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane** The sketch consists of 3 loops that make up the outer boundary and the two holes. - **Loop 1: Rectangle** This loop contains 2 lines and 2 arcs, forming a rectangle. 1. Create a line from point (0.15, 0.0) to point (0.6, 0.0). 2. Draw an arc with a center at point (0.75, 0.15), a start point at (0.6, 0.0), and an endpoint at (0.6, 0.3). 3. Draw a line from point (0.6, 0.3) to point (0.15, 0.3). 4. Draw an arc with a center at point (0.0, 0.15), a start point at (0.15, 0.3), and an endpoint at (0.15, 0.0). - **Loop 2: Hole 1** This loop contains a single circle. 1. Place a circle at point (0.15, 0.15) with a radius of 0.0562. - **Loop 3: Hole 2** This loop also contains a single circle. 1. Place a circle at point (0.6, 0.15) with a radius of 0.0562. 3. **Transform the 2D sketch into 3D sketch** Apply the coordinate system transform to the sketch to create a 3D sketch. 4. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.075 and the sketch scale to 0.75. Extrude the sketch to create the 3D model. The operation is set to "NewBodyFeatureOperation". The final dimensions of this part are: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.075 - Height: 0.75</description>
